meanings.definition: To enclose or surround within a larger structure or entity.
meanings.sent1: The farmer was englobing the sheep in the pen.
meanings.sent2: The artist was englobing different colors to create a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent3: The chef was englobing all the ingredients in a giant bowl, ready to cook.
meanings.sent4: The magician seemed to be englobing the audience in his spellbinding performance.
meanings.sent5: The spider was englobing its prey in a sticky web, waiting patiently.

meanings.definition: To include or encompass within a larger whole.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was englobing all the students' ideas in the class project.
meanings.sent2: The report was englobing all the necessary information for the presentation.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle was englobing all the missing pieces, making it complete.
meanings.sent4: The forest was englobing the small clearing, creating a peaceful oasis.
meanings.sent5: The book was englobing the reader in a world of fantasy and adventure.
